title: Firefox on my Win10 laptop - won't display weather radar images
content:
My Win10 laptop with Firefox v. 84.0.1 (64-bit) recently stopped displaying radar images on both Accuweather.com and Weather.com. It will display the background map image but fails to display the radar overlay image of precipitation, clouds, etc. I suspected at first that perhaps that might be caused by AdBlock Plus or other security/privacy software to block pop-ups; but after whitelisting both sites, examining potential options on my Firefox browser, clearing browser history, and reinstalling Firefox, I'm still unable to display radar images on either weather URL.

The failure to display radar overlays is the only symptom I've noticed. I have no difficulty displaying radar images on my cellphone or using Edge on the laptop, so it would seem the problem is somewhere in the laptop or Firefox software; but the problem on the laptop began with no apparent connection to any updates of software, Firefox, or anti-malware, which sometimes cause unexpected problems. I'm totally baffled! Do you have any suggestions for elsewhere to look?
creator: rshriner

title: Stop saving all image files as WebP?
content:
i felt like this thread never got solved and just a work around tossed at it https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1286715?page=2

i also have this problem and it started a few versions back. it seems like firefox added support for webp and there does not seem to be a way to turn it off. i have a little programming experience but i am no expert, with that in mind and using the element inspector it feels like firefox is using webp as a wrapper for jpeg but even after repeated attempts to circumvent webp and go directly to the jpg through its own src= link to save the program will still save in webp.

- i believe what would be most beneficial is for firefox to disable webp during the 'save as' essentially saving the image on your computer as intended or have an option to disable webp compatibility in its entirety.

add ons are just that, added on by some rando in their basement. i have found quite a few benign add ons that add more than advertised.

it has been my experience that if apple uses it and its not a mainstream format that its just a headache.
creator: Insulus

title: do nothing when "browser-lastwindow-close-requested" is triggered
content:
I am using services.jsm to addobserver "em-action-requested", "quit-application-granted", "quit-application-requested" : let { classes: Cc, interfaces: Ci, manager: Cm } = Components; 

 const {Services} = Components.utils.import('resource://gre/modules/Services.jsm');

function ConfigJS() { Services.obs.addObserver(this, "em-action-requested", false); Services.obs.addObserver(this, "quit-application-granted", false); Services.obs.addObserverr(this, "quit-application-requested", false); Services.obs.addObserver(this, "browser-lastwindow-close-requested", false); }


I want that when one of these actions is triggered, nothing happens (no execution of the code related to these actions). ConfigJS.prototype = { 

   observe: function (aSubject, topic, data) {

//do nothing }

does anyone have any idea how we can do this? Thank you

title: Is there any way to recover data from Program Files and not App Data?
content:
Hi everybody,

I've lost a ton of my data after copying data over to a new drive and then formatting the old one. Unfortunately, because everything is in the hidden AppData folder, I forgot to make this visible and copy it over. However, I did copy my Program Files folder, so I was wondering if there is anyway to restore data using this folder instead?

There really ought to be a backup in there because people who are less experienced probably don't realise there is a hidden AppData folder.

I managed to restore the data from the hard disk but unfortunately it appears to be corrupt. I have tried the Jefferson Scher tool, sadly it just showed up a bunch of symbols which were question marks inside a diamond so I think that may mean it's corrupt.

I've lost bookmarks and extensions. Two of the extensions were also tools that stored more data (one was a session saver and the other a to do list which had lots of ideas written down). It would be great if I could get any of this back.

I have all of the data that was inside the Program Files, but have lost all of the AppData files.

Kind regards,

Jordan
creator: JordyC123

title: About opening a tab in a new tab (not new window) conveniently
content:
I found when pressing Alt+Enter in the address bar, the link will open in a new tab, which is nice. But if I press Alt+click a link in the page, the link does not open in a new tab (while Shift+click can open in a new window as expected). I'm not sure if it's a problem, but I hope Firefox can have this feature so that opening a link in a new tab can be more convenient.

Besides, in some browsers, drag a link to a nearby place will open in a new tab. However, in Firefox, this manner does not work, unless I drag a link to the tabs bar.

title: Disably overly insisting updates
content:
When Firefox asks if I want to download an update and I agree, soon after that but not right away it stops working - on every new page it says "we need to restart to finish updating" <- this last bit is VERY annoying. Is there a way to keep FF working in such situation? I usually have 3 FF profiles running, about 10-20 tabs each and when it suddenly does this - I can restart them all but when it is suitable for me.

The only solution I can see so far is disabling updates via group policies (which is not well documented, where do i put this policies.json on fedora? need to google that).

Any other ways to keep updates and FF running until I decide when to restart? Thanks.
